info.name: EASB - Province Module API
info.description: API collection for Province Module - managing Indonesian province master data with code, name, and active status.

item.name: Province Management (SUPERADMIN Only)

request.description:
Create a new province. Requires SUPERADMIN role only.

**Fields:**
- `kode` (string, required): Province code (1-10 chars, must be unique)
- `nama` (string, required): Province name (1-255 chars)
- `isActive` (boolean, optional): Active status (default: true)

Update an existing province. Requires SUPERADMIN role only.

**Fields:**
- `id` (number, required): Province ID to update
- `kode` (string, optional): New province code (1-10 chars)
- `nama` (string, optional): New province name (1-255 chars)
- `isActive` (boolean, optional): New active status

Soft delete a province. Requires SUPERADMIN role only.

**Fields:**
- `id` (number, required): Province ID to delete

**Note:** This performs a soft delete (sets deleted_at timestamp).

item.description: CRUD operations for province management - All endpoints require SUPERADMIN role

item.name: Province Queries (SUPERADMIN Only)

request.description:
Get paginated list of all provinces. Requires SUPERADMIN role only.

**Request Body:**
- `page` (number, required): Page number (min: 1)
- `amount` (number, required): Items per page (min: 1)

**Response includes:**
- `provinces`: Array of Province objects
- `total`: Total number of provinces
- `page`: Current page
- `amount`: Items per page
- `totalPages`: Total number of pages

Get detailed information for a specific province. Requires SUPERADMIN role only.

**Request Body:**
- `id` (number, required): Province ID to retrieve

**Returns:** Complete Province object with all fields

item.name: Example Use Cases

request.description:
Example of creating provinces for Indonesian provinces:

Common province codes:
- `11` = Aceh
- `12` = Sumatera Utara
- `31` = DKI Jakarta
- `32` = Jawa Barat
- `33` = Jawa Tengah
- `35` = Jawa Timur
- `51` = Bali
- `73` = Sulawesi Selatan

Note: Execute this request multiple times with different data to create multiple provinces.

Example of deactivating a province without deleting it.

This is useful when you want to temporarily disable a province without removing it from the database.

request.description:
Example of a successful response:

```json
{
  "status": "success",
  "responseCode": 200,
  "message": "Province detail retrieved",
  "data": {
    "id": 1,
    "kode": "31",
    "nama": "DKI Jakarta",
    "isActive": true,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-25T10:30:00.000Z",
    "updatedAt": "2024-11-25T10:30:00.000Z",
    "deletedAt": null
  }
}
```

Example of an error when trying to create a province with duplicate code:

```json
{
  "status": "error",
  "responseCode": 409,
  "message": "Province code already exists",
  "data": null
}
```
